value.value_text: September 23, 1980  Bronx, New York, New York

paragraphs.body: Murray was born in the Bronx, New York, to poor and drug-addicted parents, both of whom would later contract HIV. She became homeless just after she turned 15 when her mother died of AIDS and her father moved to a homeless shelter. Despite personal adversity, Murray began attending the Humanities Preparatory Academy in Chelsea, Manhattan, and graduated two years later. She was awarded a New York Times scholarship for needy students and was accepted into Harvard University, matriculating in the fall semester of 2000. Her older sister Lisa graduated from Purchase College in New York State and is a school teacher for children with autism.
paragraphs.text: Murray was born in the Bronx, New York, to poor and drug-addicted parents, both of whom would later contract HIV. She became homeless just after she turned 15 when her mother died of AIDS and her father moved to a homeless shelter. Despite personal adversity, Murray began attending the Humanities Preparatory Academy in Chelsea, Manhattan, and graduated two years later. She was awarded a New York Times scholarship for needy students and was accepted into Harvard University, matriculating in the fall semester of 2000. Her older sister Lisa graduated from Purchase College in New York State and is a school teacher for children with autism.

paragraphs.body: In late 2006, her father died of AIDS. She returned to Harvard in 2006 and graduated in June 2009. As of August 2009, she began taking graduate courses at Harvard Summer School with plans to earn a doctorate in clinical psychology and become a counselor.
paragraphs.text: In late 2006, her father died of AIDS. She returned to Harvard in 2006 and graduated in June 2009. As of August 2009, she began taking graduate courses at Harvard Summer School with plans to earn a doctorate in clinical psychology and become a counselor.

paragraphs.body: She is the founder and director of Manifest Living and a motivational speaker. A made-for-TV film about Murray's life, Homeless to Harvard: The Liz Murray Story, was released in 2003. Liz Murray's New York Times and Sunday Times bestselling memoir Breaking Night was released in September 2010.
paragraphs.text: She is the founder and director of Manifest Living and a motivational speaker. A made-for-TV film about Murray's life, Homeless to Harvard: The Liz Murray Story, was released in 2003. Liz Murray's New York Times and Sunday Times bestselling memoir Breaking Night was released in September 2010.

paragraphs.body: On May 19, 2013, she was awarded an honorary doctorate of public service and gave the Commencement address at Merrimack College in North Andover, Massachusetts.
paragraphs.text: On May 19, 2013, she was awarded an honorary doctorate of public service and gave the Commencement address at Merrimack College in North Andover, Massachusetts.
